Package smartgraph.view.graphview

Class SmartGraphEdgeCurve<E,​V>

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.shape.Shape
javafx.scene.shape.CubicCurve
smartgraph.view.graphview.SmartGraphEdgeCurve<E,​V>
Type Parameters:
E - Type stored in the underlying edge
V - Type of connecting vertex
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, SmartGraphEdge<E,​V>, SmartGraphEdgeBase<E,​V>, SmartLabelledNode, SmartStylableNode
public class SmartGraphEdgeCurve<E,​V>
extends javafx.scene.shape.CubicCurve
implements SmartGraphEdgeBase<E,​V>
Concrete implementation of a curved edge.
The edge binds its start point to the outbound SmartGraphVertexNode center and its end point to the inbound SmartGraphVertexNode center. As such, the curve is updated automatically as the vertices move.
Given there can be several curved edges connecting two vertices, when calling the constructor SmartGraphEdgeCurve(Edge, SmartGraphVertexNode, SmartGraphVertexNode, int) the edgeIndex can be specified as to create non-overlaping curves.

  • Method Details

    • setStyleClass

      public void setStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.

      The cssClass string must not contain a preceding dot, e.g., "myClass" instead of ".myClass".

      The CSS Class must be defined in smartpgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.

      The expected behavior is to remove all current styling before applying the class css.

      Specified by:
      setStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • addStyleClass

      public void addStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies cumulatively the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.

      The CSS Class must be defined in smartpgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.

      The cumulative operation will overwrite any existing styling elements previously defined for previous classes.

      Specified by:
      addStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • removeStyleClass

      public boolean removeStyleClass​(java.lang.String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Removes a previously cssClass existing CSS styling.

      Given styles can be added sequentially, the removal of a css class will be a removal that keeps the previous ordering of kept styles.

      Specified by:
      removeStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.
      Returns:
      true if successful; false if cssClass wasn't previously set.
